gap_indicators: Massive price jump from hobbyist to enterprise (10x+)
Mid-market companies struggle with DIY solutions
Growing AI adoption in non-tech companies
Lack of managed AI infrastructure for SMBs
target_customers: Series A-B startups building AI features
SaaS companies adding AI to existing products
top_opportunity.competitive_weakness: Enterprise players focus on Fortune 500, indie tools lack reliability/scale
value_props_needed: Simple API for common AI tasks

all_gaps.identified_gap: Growing teams ($75-250/mo) need more power without enterprise complexity
gap_indicators: Zapier pricing jumps quickly with task volume
Power users hit limits on starter plans
Growing teams need custom integrations
Developer-friendly alternatives underpriced
all_gaps.competitive_weakness: Leaders charge per-task, creating unpredictable costs

all_gaps.identified_gap: Professional tier ($150-400/mo) missing for growing API-first companies
gap_indicators: Free tiers too limited for serious use
Enterprise tiers over-featured for growing companies
API economy growing rapidly
Developer tools market expanding
all_gaps.competitive_weakness: Postman focuses on testing, lacks full lifecycle management
all_gaps.recommended_pricing: $199-$449/mo (tiered by team size and API requests)

all_gaps.identified_gap: Mid-market CDP ($400-1200/mo) with simpler setup needed
gap_indicators: Enterprise CDPs have 6-12 month implementations
Mid-market needs simpler setup and maintenance
Data warehouse complexity barrier
Privacy regulations driving demand
all_gaps.competitive_weakness: Segment/mParticle expensive, Rudderstack requires technical setup
value_props_needed: Simple visual interface for non-technical users

all_gaps.identified_gap: Growing startups ($150-500/mo) need more than basic but not enterprise
gap_indicators: Retool dominates but expensive for smaller teams
Many companies still using spreadsheets
Remote work increasing need for internal tools
No-code movement reducing technical barriers
target_customers: Customer success teams building client portals
all_gaps.competitive_weakness: Retool priced for engineering teams, not business users
value_props_needed: Template library for common use cases
No-code first with code escape hatch

key_findings: Average pricing gap between SMB and Enterprise tiers is 5-10x
Mid-market segment ($100-500/mo ARR potential) consistently underserved
Buyers willing to pay 2-3x for reliability + team features without complexity
AI/ML tooling shows highest opportunity score (92/100)
Usage-based pricing creating anxiety - flat tiers preferred for budget predictability
market_patterns: Freemium to Enterprise jump: Most products have weak mid-tier offerings
Team features paywall: Collaboration locked behind expensive plans
Support quality gap: Chat support vs. dedicated CSM with nothing between
Implementation complexity: Enterprise tools require consultants, SMB tools too limited
winning_strategies: Launch at $299-599/mo sweet spot with generous limits
Offer predictable flat pricing with 'fair use' caps
Include team features from day one (5-10 seats)
Provide white-glove onboarding without ongoing CSM requirement
Target Series A-B companies and 20-100 person bootstrapped companies
risk_factors: Incumbents may expand mid-market offerings if successful
Sales motion: Self-serve vs light-touch sales unclear
Customer acquisition cost may be high in competitive categories
Product differentiation critical - pricing alone won't win
